title: ‘A diverse and rewarding experience’
pros: Working with high quality people in one of the top accounting firms globally; Having access to great resources; Having the opportunity to work overseas; Having the opportunity to provide professional services to a diverse range of businesses. KPMG has a first class reputation and opens doors to many other future opportunities.
cons: The work load can be quite high depending on the division/ team; Being a professional services firm means that all projects are according to client deadlines.

title: ‘There are some hard time working at KPMG, but overall I like working there. It will enhance your future career, and if you try hard, the reward is great I think. Also it is very flexible to work there as long as  you finish your work.’
pros:
You will gain professional knowledge and it will open lots of opportunities. 
I enjoyed working with very intelligent people.
Also, it is good to stay wktk KPMG, but if you are looking for another career, working with one of the big 4 accounting companies will stand out the resume.
Also, good benefits such as discount gift card etc.
cons:
Work and life balance. So far, I am handling the most of the time, but I know other people are having hard time some times.
Also, there are some pressure to complete the job. And some times you may feel very big stress.

title: ‘KPMG is a brilliant company to work for. They pride themselves on their diversity, encouragement of employee growth, wide range of opportunity and forward thinking work environments.’
pros: Great focus on personal development which is rewarded with a pay rise.
cons: One on one client base service can be intimidating.

title: ‘Outstanding environment to learn, grow and mentor others while engaging a good mix of local, national experience with reach back to global knowlrdge and expertise.’
pros: People, culture, diversity and the diverse range of clients.  Ability to work internationally across multiple industries and market sectors
cons: Amount of interstate travel and i hate hot desking when in the office

title: ‘It is absolutely fNastic’
pros: The team and friendliness. Everyone helps everyone else, Having a fantastic team leader helps
cons: Getting everything out on time all the time. The pressure is there but you can have fun with it

title: ‘Great place to work in some ways, but constrained in others.’
pros: Good work environment, great brand, extensive knowledge base and internal tools
cons:
Career advancement can depend on being aligned to the right power groups, Performance bench marking is done on a national level using unknown criteria, possibly not taking local factors into account. This also applies to performance bonus, with the outdated bell curve shaping method.
Making a successful career in consulting is skewed towards young people who are taken in as graduates or at early stages in their career and then indoctrinated over the years. Older professionals who are recruited as lateral hires may struggle in this respect despite their wealth of experience and life skills.

title: ‘Helped me discover my potential by growing and learning as part of a team.’
pros:
Very goal oriented to help you progress individually and as part of a team.
Encourages you to be a self motivator.
Pushes you out of your comfort zone.
cons:
You can feel lost in a large organisation if you don't put yourself out there.
Quite a heirarchical structure that could do with some freshening up.

title: ‘Great company and the length of my career at KPMG is portrayed on my CV.’
pros: EA Development and the opportunity to get involved in exciting internal and external events and projects. Volunteering for huge charities through KPMG.
cons: Goal setting and the programme used for this is not flowing.

title: ‘Hard, but educational.’
pros: Great offices and clients. Broad range of experience and a great place to surround yourself with people of above-average intellect. You definitely don't meet many \"passengers\".  I keep working here because the average drive of the person sitting next to me is way higher than anywhere else I've been in my career. It pushes me further and faster than I thought I'd ever be able to go.
cons:
Structure has setup unfortunate amounts of competition between partners and business areas, making multi-disciplinary work near impossible. While they love forming those teams on large high-profile work, \"smaller jobs\" (sub 250k) seldom see other specialists involved. 

Wages are lower than competition (literally every offer I've had since joining has exceeded my wage by at least 20%), and an emphasis on reducing overheads means investment cases are mostly all talk. They also place too much value on loyalty, meaning wage negotiations often go off the rails leaving a good deal of the talent open to poaching by other firms that actually do invest. I recommend you get to know the team really well before committing, and never accept a promise of future investment on the words of senior partners alone - they're so seldom the decision makers anyway. This includes training and education - policies are always trumped by chargeable work, no matter how far in front of your targets you are (the people who get the most perks are often those with the least to do).

title: ‘Lovely, intelligent, self-motivated people who are great to work with’
pros: Flexible, fun and focussed work place. Many exciting opportunities to grow, develop and challenge yourself.
cons: The demands are high - but so are the rewards. Definitely not for those who like a slow pace - but if you enjoy a dynamic, stimulating, fast moving work environment its amazing.

title: ‘Good experience but not recommended to stay for too long.’
pros: Good career progression, training and development opportunities, highly sought after experience by recruiters/industry, good exposure to different industries financial accounts/reporting.
cons: Long working hours, poor work life balance, high pressure environment, no down time, lack of training in business development (for managers) and expectation to win clients, sometimes allocated very incompetent team members to manage on clients, people managers/partners don't really care about what you are going through, partners' unrealistic focus on profit in jobs at the expense of team members mental health & life.

title: ‘Lots of development but long hours.’
pros: There is a great opportunity to develop yourself and your skills at KPMG with a lot of training and development.  There is lots of specific and specialised support particularly in relation to passing the CA.
cons: Having a good work life balance.  The hours are particularly long, The pay is particularly poor when you compare what you earn to what similar level people earn in the industry.

title: ‘Not paid enough for long hours but great international exposure and training’
pros: Great opportunities for overseas secondment. Good training provided. Discounts with many providers as part of benefits package. Good bonus structures. Fun events quarterly and end of year. Able to get certain overtime back as time in lieu.
cons: Salary matches the market but lower than in commerce industry. Long hours as is the case in this industry. Not always opportunity for promotion.

title: ‘Best 6 years of my career - a busy, supportive environment.’
pros: Genuine hard work and significant achievements are recognised via accolades.  Work/life balance is very well managed, and social networking opportunities are abundant.  Staff are very industrious and friendly.
cons: Career advancement in certain disciplines.   You can progress in IT, but it takes consistency in achievements, and potentially many years, regardless of experience.  Lateral role movements is usually the way.

title: ‘Great opportunity to broaden your view and learn technical skills’
pros: The firm is very friendly and respectful between colleagues. It provides you with many opportunities to learn new things
cons: Sometimes you are unable to attend some company activities on weekend as you want to spend time with your families

title: ‘It's good for networking and bad for career progression. There is a strong churn and burn culture.’
pros: There are great opportunities to work on interesting engagements and work with diverse and interesting clients.
cons: Opportunities for career development are limited. There is a lack of support during some engagements, especially those involving long days exceeding 12 hours.

title: ‘Rewarding to a point you decide you are not a lifer.’
pros: Career progression is good and clear with high achievement awarded. Environment is designed to push a high performing culture.
cons: Work/life balance is not easy to achieve due to high workloads and severe time sensitivity of engagements. Management tend to push work down without consistent guidance.

title: ‘Great experience, never regretted’
pros: The variety in my role even though it was a fixed term contract. Great location and great team I worked with.
cons: Being a fixed term contract it was difficult to not want to get too involved. It was unfortunate that the role could not be extended.

title: ‘A challenging, rewarding experience’
pros: I enjoy the independence of working in a large team and being made accountable for a lot of the client deliverables. I enjoy the balance of being able to come to work a bit later and leave a bit earlier, and being able to take leave as required. I also enjoy the company of those I work with.
cons:
There are times when you need to juggle many high priority items at once. This can lead to working late nights and, consequently, foregoing a work/life balance.
The biggest asset of this organisation is its people, and working in a people environment (especially in teams that tend to be quite large) can mean that not everyone gets along. This is challenging, however you learn people skills that prove valuable in every area of your life.
There are times when you need to run meetings that you have no idea what they are about. Whilst this is daunting, you learn to develop a thick skin.

title: ‘After a long career in financial services with NAB it was an absolute pleasure to learn about the professional services industry with such a highly regarded global organisation as KPMG.’
pros: Extremely fair and very supportive in terms of providing challenging opportunities and exposure to organizations that aligned to my risk management skill set. Unquestionable support for me personally whilst going through a kidney transplant process over 12 mths and returning to work full time.
cons:
Retention of talent.
KPMG, promote a quality graduate program and provide a range of diversified opportunities and experiences for their staff. The graduates are exposed to varied engagements and learn fast. 
They absorb knowledge and become senior so quickly beyond their years.

title: ‘Great start and experience, but don't be a lifer’
pros: Varied work, opportunity to work in various industries, and good culture and corporate life.
cons: Little control over where you work, business needs trump all other considerations, processes are often broken or opaque

title: ‘Great work environment just wish there was more money in what I did unfortunately the business believes we are not generating revenue therefore the business will not increase the salary in my role at all and will only contract people ito the role.’
pros: Fantastic team. Great opportunities within the firm and all amazing benefits like Bupa and Cinema ticket discounts
cons: The salary is not the best and at times work load is very high for a team of only 3 in the specific role I am involved with.

title: ‘A great experience managing change in professional services.’
pros: Working with a winning team. Clear strategy and ability to connect what I was doing with the firm's success.
cons: The constant and unsurprising drive to reduce costs. Discordance between a minority of partners behaviours and the firm's expectations.

title: ‘Great for networking’
pros: Great atmosphere
cons: Pressure to stay within the company, ambiguous expectations

title: ‘Employee is just a number in partner's mind. ’
pros: Nice office. meet lots of people.
cons: It is all about hitting the target and make more $ for the partners.

title: ‘Good company to launch career in accounting.’
pros: Diverse clients and global exposure
cons: Low on technology

title: ‘Love the office and team. ’
pros: Love the team, staff
cons: Working ia not a challenge,  but moving to next level career

title: ‘Challenging opportunities with terrible pay’
pros: Challenging problems for clients
cons: Pathetic pay and isn't structured well

title: ‘Work hard and you won’t be rewarded. ’
pros: The friends made along the way.
cons: Very low salaries in comparison to industry standards.

title: ‘Fulfilment’
pros: Work life balance where you can manage your own time, managers give you the benefit of the doubt
cons: Micromanaging and inefficient staff

title: ‘Have learnt a lot but would not go back or recommend’
pros: Good work life balance, good mat leave for careers (14w), great offices, free fruit & coffee
cons: Salary is very low compared to other Big4 & market, turn over is very high, management not given resources to be managers

title: ‘It was an experience that I learnt a lot from but you must be prepared to make work your life’
pros: Nice people, solid company
cons: Bad management,  bad communication, low pay for long hours

title: ‘Great place to work’
pros: Good culture.  great workplace
cons: Expect you to be available 24/7

title: ‘Wouldn't go back..’
pros: Working in good teams, high quality outcomes for clients
cons: Too much politics! Not a fair performance mgmt. system - very clique-y!

title: ‘Filled with highs and lows, a great experience overall however.’
pros: Great leadership, international opportunities, flexible working arrangements.
cons: Work/life balance, often stressful.

title: ‘KPMG has been a wonderful but challenging employer. ’
pros: Wonderful work/life balance.
cons: High expectations are expected of employees of KPMG

title: ‘Best organisation I have ever worked for.’
pros: Opportunity to develop your career in a supportive environment. Engaging, dynamic and inclusive employer. Supportive and encouraging of innovation.
cons: None identified.

title: ‘Great platform for your career in accounting/finance’
pros: Great team working environment
cons: Achieving a balance between work and personal life was always a challenge

title: ‘All the technology, none of the people skills.’
pros: They had a nice selection of plants
cons:
Management was in another state and clueless.
The people I was working with would not entertain the possibility of change, or more efficient ways of working.
There was a class divide between the beautiful/rich/fresh from Uni and the average/learned on the job/life experience types.

title: ‘A good large organisation to work at.’
pros: Diversity and friendly people
cons: Lack of opportunities or promotions in my role as they focus on the client facing staff only.

title: ‘Working at KPMG was a good experience.’
pros: Good work life balance.
cons: Some of the managers are not well organised.

title: ‘Avoid if you can’
pros: They pay you on time
cons: Everything else...office politics, work life balance, no promotion without you knowing somebody higher up

title: ‘Lots of arrogance from the upper levels’
pros: Interesting projects with large corporates who want to improve, fantastic view over Darling Harbour.
cons: Overselling of cookie-cutter solutions, delivered by inexperienced junior staff. Resulting in clients being underwhelmed, and providing bad feedback to partners, in order to up the ante (which they can't because that would reduce their profits/bonuses).

title: ‘Training and induction was poor, and when this was mentioned to the partner, no care or interest was taken. Partners were also absent and uninterested in career development or advancing the skills of any of the junior staff. Group was also poorly lead and’
pros: The firm at large has a focus on wellbeing, fantastic staff benefits, great network building opportunities
cons: Poor leadership, absent leaders, lack of direction, lack of caterer development, lack of training

title: ‘At the beginning working for KPMG was excellent until a change of management. ’
pros: Experience over 11 years
cons: Working with with challenging people

title: ‘Great learning experience and a great pathway for the future in the corporate world.’
pros: Great team
cons: Travel

title: ‘Good for a few years until you risk burnout.’
pros: Flexibility, some great people, good learning experience.
cons: Extremely high pressure and deadline driven environment.

title: ‘Need to get their priorities right.’
pros: The brand and products. Some of the people working there.
cons: The management. Slow to change and very old hierarchical management style. Cut corners over safety.

title: ‘Good experience, good team, friendly atmosphere, monotonous work.’
pros: The co workers were friendly and my particular management looked out for staff. There were quite a few paid for work functions which were well attended.
cons: The work was very monotonous.

title: ‘Good place to work if you’re looking for a big name’
pros: Modern building, daily breakfast
cons: No opportunity for growth. Salary below average and managers don’t really care about their employees.

title: ‘Positive working environment with team work spirit.’
pros:
Professionalism
Team work
respect individuals
cons: Severe competition with other big four. Marketing pressure.

title: ‘If you like 80 hour weeks (including weekends) and want to get a trusted brand on your CV, go for it’
pros: Brand, no quarterly earning pressure
cons: People management, career development

title: ‘Professionally run.’
pros: I was working as a temp so my experience was skewed. As a cycling commuter they had a good set up & was about to improve it.
cons: No real challenges as I was in the internal print department which was run very well.

title: ‘Great place to work if you don't need money to survive!’
pros: It's people! The culture is great.
cons: The salary is very low.

title: ‘World class’
pros: Great training and world class facilities, good people
cons: Little to no work life balance

title: ‘Underwhelmed ’
pros: Nothing to report unfortunately
cons: Too many to list. Unfortunately

title: ‘Great place to launch your career.’
pros: Client and work exposures
cons: Constant deadlines and work demands makes maintaining work/life balance challenging.

title: ‘My skill set aligns perfectly with my team.’
pros: Stong company culture and a very transparent vision statement and corporate strategy.
cons: A very top heavy management team.

title: ‘Great so far’
pros: Career opportunities, experience
cons: Time management is a hurdle to overcome

title: ‘Led a wide range of engagements which I would have not been able to get involved in, significantly developing my skills and future career opportunity.’
pros: Brand, career development
cons: Work load and remuneration

title: ‘A great culture with people who strive to be the best and bring out the best in you.’
pros: The culture and the people
cons: Poor salary and poor career profession opportunities

title: ‘Hospitality day no weekends’
pros:
Low stress 
Appreciative management 
Friendly careing team

title: ‘It's what you make of it’

Expert Partners
Trusted Relationships

Very hierarchical 
Not agile enough

title: ‘You are well supported to achieve your best’
pros: Flexibility and variety of work

title: ‘A roller coaster ride with wings’
pros: Great supportive team, highly flexible and forward thinking.
cons: Low pay compared to what you can get in the market

title: ‘Great team, poor leadership’
pros: My team and the IT team in general were great
cons: Management really killed the culture within KPMG

title: ‘All that glitters is not always gold.’
pros: The office is big with state of art technology.
cons: Stressfull environment to work. Everyone looks so stressed. There is work pressure.

title: ‘Learn a lot in a large company’
pros: Good brand. Friendly people. Good training
cons: Large corporation means it can be a bit impersonal

title: ‘Stimulating environment with great people’
pros: Great team
cons: Working with some partners

title: ‘Not great. Could be so much better’
pros: Great opportunities but only if you are part of the chosen few.
cons: Dealing with the people.

title: ‘Good but not great place to work ’
pros: Opportunity to help a diverse range of clients. Genuine problem solving projects. Get to work with smart people.
cons: Some managers are not leaders. Reactive to staff survey results. Training is limited.

title: ‘Understaffed causing standards that are set too high without proper communication and just below average wages’
pros: Internal opportunities and working for a well known company
cons: Management and fair workload

title: ‘Challenging but not stimulating ’
pros:
Good location
Good facilities and view from office
Long lunch break
Comprehensive training and access to modules
cons:
Low pay
Working overtime is the norm
Some people are not inclusive
You are looked at as an easy replacement

title: ‘A wonderful learning experience with full support from peers and senior staff.’
pros: A fantastic learning environment and work-life balance.
cons: Only having 24 hours in a day.

title: ‘Dynamic and beneficial experience which is a great investment for the future’
pros: Great experience, great future network, great future opportunities
cons: Work life balance

title: ‘Not a place to aspire to work at for a career’
pros: Ability to work on diverse client engagements
cons: Performance management system is toxic and has an acute lack of leadership

title: ‘Their eyes on money.’
pros: If you know how to please those high level staffs, your path will be great no matter your  work performance is good or bad.
cons: How to please those high level staffs.

title: ‘Learing environment with great bunch of staff.’
pros: An professional environment.
cons: The deadline audits

title: ‘Great experience’
pros: Reputable company, great experience.
cons: Huge company, not personal. Audit department has a constant turnover of employees. Highly stressed.

title: ‘Loved it’
pros: Everyone is very professional and friendly
cons: Lacking of Work life balance

title: ‘I love working at KPMG’
pros: KPMG offers a great work environment and great work life balance.
cons: Getting to know everyone is challenging because of the large numbers of staff.

title: ‘Not somewhere I would ever work again.’
pros: The team are lovely.
cons: Leadership are lacking in ability and talent.

title: ‘If you are a potential experienced lateral hire, think carefully before making the leap.’
pros: Plenty of opportunities to involved in various projects and exposure to a variety of work. Culturally a very diverse group of staff. Technology enabled flexible work arrangements.
cons:
Very challenging for lateral hires to assimilate into the organisation. Highly indoctrinated corporate culture with a nauseating performance review/feedback loop. They make no secret that most hires sink or swim within their first year. The work environment favours graduates/juniors organically progressing within the organisation. 
Highly political work environment. To survive and thrive you must curry favour with your reporting manager or a power group/figure. The 'agile' workspace could be a challenge to those used to an office.

title: ‘Rewarding.’
pros: Working part time 24
cons: Going on leave, I usually have to work extra hours to ensure everything is completed before I can go on leave.  The extra hours usually add up to nearly my normal working week, without pay!   Xmas is usually a compulsory 3 week break!

title: ‘Great experience in a international firm’
pros: Culture, staff, positive work environment
cons: None really noted, everyone was open and willing

title: ‘Good job, great views over harbour and well paid.’
job_title: Personal Assistant To Partner And His Team.
pros: Great social events, nice people.
cons: Could be a stressful workplace at times with deadlines. I worked for a Partner and his team of accountants.

title: ‘Great place to work’
pros: Great work environment
cons: Finding your social circle in such a close grouped environment

title: ‘Not worth it’
pros: International environment
cons: Not efficient management and partership. Poor attention to the life- work balance , very low and not competitive salary, high level of stress and poor attention to professional growing.

title: ‘Good place to kick off career’
pros: Colleagues
cons: Low pay, long hours

title: ‘Amazing learning and development opportunities’
pros:
Learning and development
Rapid career progression
Excellent post graduate study support 
Great culture
cons:
Demanding work
Can require a significant about of overtime
Pay is average (but consistent with the Big4)
Low opportunities for innovation

title: ‘Great career starting experience.’
pros: Friendly people to work with. Range of clients to work on.
cons: Some client work can go on for a while

title: ‘If you are willing to exchange long hours/low pay for the chance of faster career progression, this is the place for you’
pros: Good career progression, varied work, great people
cons: Long hours, low pay, terrible budgeting

title: ‘Great career starter with ample opportunity to progress once committed.’
pros: Opportunity to progress, variety of work
cons: Tight deadlines, work/life balance, staff shortage at some levels

title: ‘Loved working there and miss the people’
pros: People and culture.  Every one works together as a big team
cons: Sometimes hard to find the work / life balance

title: ‘Professional organisation ’
pros: Great learning and expeience
cons: Traditional methods but effrctivr

title: ‘They keep the employee until they need but when it is time to give back, they don't keep you anymore.’
pros: Good payment and lots of employees which makes environment good to learn and for teamwork
cons: High workload and quick deadlines are set to pressure the employee which makes hard to maintain work life balance.

title: ‘My experience was really good.’
pros: The team were really helpful and really nice.
cons: I had no challenges because my team will always help me overcome them

title: ‘Stepping stone for broader career opportunities but not great work life balance’
pros: Good opportunities if you seek them out (i.e. travel / exposure to build networks etc)
cons: Difficult to maintain work life balance.  Culture can be negative at times.

title: ‘Work is ok but the sallary is very terribel company pays only minimum legal wages’
pros: Big firm with lots of opportunities
cons: Being able to finish all tasks queries on time

title: ‘Great place to learn and be pushed to extremes!’
pros: Managed a great team of people who respected me and supported each other.
cons: One director made my experience here a nightmare. After he had handed or reorganised all my tasks to his employment choices, he then removed me through redundancy. He then proceeded to move to other sections in the group and repeat the process. He was eventually shown the door. All his employment choices were known to him through other corporates he had worked and followed his behaviour.

title: ‘Lots of hard work, but worth it for the experience and growth opportunities.’
pros: The experience gained in a very short amount of time is second to none, from the end of your first year you are supervising juniors and leading teams, plus getting exposure to the leadership at clients that client staff often don’t have. The ability to grow within your role is also far beyond a role in industry, given the diversity of the client base and the types of projects we assist clients with.
cons: The pressure to deliver is immense, which turns into many extra hours of work. Combined with a very low starting salary compared to industry, your effective hourly rate is very low for the first few years, but will rise at a much faster rate than an equivalent role in industry.

title: ‘It has a truly multi-cultural, multi-racial workforce.  This diversity makes it a vibrant company in which to work. I enjoyed the fast paced learning there, the people are  capable, motivated, intelligent, hard working and talented.’
job_title: Manager - Business Intelligence, Analytics And Modeling (Advisory)
pros: Diversity , learning and development opportunity
cons: Work/life balance

title: ‘Painful.’
pros:
- Less travel required compared to other management consulting firms
- Good audit practice
- Patches of talent
cons:
- Dead wood.
- Slowest of the Big 4 to adapt to market changes.
- Good consultants leave for better firms.
- Struggling to differentiate itself.
- Inconsistent quality of work.
- Insular, political culture.
- No focus on client satisfaction.
- Brand identity stuck in the 1990's.

title: ‘Interesting, intellectual challenging and living on adrenalin’
pros: Interesting and challenging work. Exposure to projects you would not normally get. Working with high performers and supportive teams.
cons: Huge hours to meet project and revenue targets. Lots of travel that doesn't count as work time, i.e 0600 flights out and getting home a 22:00.

title: ‘Supportive and challenging environment’
pros: Brilliant people to work with, supportive partners and managers. Surrounded by highly intelligent people who are caring and friendly. Very diverse and inclusive workplace. Highly recommend.
cons: Long hours as is standard with Big 4 firms.

title: ‘It is good working for the big 4 and good experience and career progression.’
pros: Agile working and Flexibility
cons: Very process oriented

title: ‘Challenging and rewarding’
pros: Career development is fast, high learning curve, given great responsibilities to manage engagements
cons: Heavy work load, quick staff turnover, short of staff during busy season

title: ‘A great company to work for ’
pros: The best company I've worked for, during my 9 year career. They give you responsibility and value hard work and innovation
cons: I'd love to have been able to move into another area of the business, but they attract a lot of great candidates externally so it's sometimes tough to compete

title: ‘A great opportunity to see how a large organisation works.’
pros: Working in a big company is a great experience. The culture of the wider team is exciting and inspiring and the friendships made make the company a great place to work.
cons: Working in a company run by a partnership is not a great hierarchy. There are constant power struggles and many partners who don't get along. Reward and recognition often favours women due to diversity but this can some time be unfair to the wider team.

title: ‘The drive, passion, vision of KPMG has given me a new lease on my abilities.’
pros: I was given an opportunity in a world first project and took it with both hands. The IT staff were some of the best people I have ever worked with. Their drive, passion and vision had me enthralled.
cons: Delivering a brand new laptop with all data transferred and introducing Windows 8.1 to over 5000 KPMG employees Nationally not only on time & within budget but 6 weeks earlier than projected.

title: ‘I was very proud to be part of the KPMG family and I thoroughly enjoyed all my roles within the firm.’
pros: Being a large organisation there were many opportunities to branch out career wise- Flexibility and working agile was a positive and social life was excellent.
cons: At times long hours with little or no break.  Not enough hours in the day for the amount of work that required completion.

title: ‘Pockets of great partnerships within the firm keep it successful but overall limited opportunities kept talent away ’
pros:
Interesting projects
Great project teams
Respectful clients 
Problem solving for the c suite
cons:
Melbourne versus Sydney divide impacted career paths 
Leadership styles in some groups had no transparency 
Limited political backing to be given leadership opportunities

title: ‘A dynamic and enlightened way of working’
pros: KPMG have world-class facilities, a practical dress code and flexible working options for all employees. With work from home readily accepted, you're free to run your life in the way it works best for your role.
cons: The firm moves slowly. With ingrained ways of working, disruption takes longer.

title: ‘Management pick their favorites’
pros: Variety of work is good and it is also quite challenging which I enjoyed. The people I worked with also made it easy to go into work every day
cons: The partnership group generally. Communication is poor and there is little reward for effort. If one of the partners has something against you, don't expect to progress anywhere!

title: ‘Fast paced’
pros: Lots of varied opportunities
cons:
Agile environment means that people are less likely to pick up the phone
People in positions of power
Part time role, not necessarily part time

title: ‘One of the best IT companies to work for.’
pros: Awesome work env. Great management
cons: Salary alignment with market

title: ‘If you want big 4 experience dont go to KPMG try the others’
pros: The only good aspect of working at KPMG is the variety of clients you work on and learning different environments
cons: Long working hours due to inability to retain staff. No clear growth path in terms of promotions. Increases are very minor and they definitely pay lower than industry. Bonuses are not guaranteed. Management is over critical and push responsibility to lower level staff.

title: ‘Good but not great’
pros: Great regard for work life balance.
cons: Old senior management (Directors/Partners), with little if ever a turnover, making it very difficult to bring a change or adapt to new opportunities. The firm is mostly then a follower in industry trends instead of a leader.

title: ‘Terrible’
pros: The event catering was always tastey.
cons: The people you work with. No respect what so ever.

title: ‘Career damaging’
pros: Variable nature of work
cons: Colleagues undermining and setting up to fail

title: ‘Pretty good, less talk more action!’
pros: There are good morals and vision
cons: If your not client facing you can be forgotten

title: ‘Quite good’
pros: Offices and staff benefits
cons: Nothing overly, management could be better at delivering messages all the way down the line

title: ‘No part timers please!’
pros: New office space, generally friendly environment
cons: Not supportive of part time employment. Slow to make decisions. Partnership structure is clunky.

title: ‘Great experience to build your career at an early stage and provide a foundation for you future aspirations.’
pros: Great experience with a variety of work across different industries and environments.
cons: Work/life balance, the business always expects you to go the extra mile and sacrifice your personal time.

title: ‘A great place to progress your career, build your networks and skills and make lifelong friends’
pros: Teamwork, collaboration and focus in the client facing divisions
cons: Lack of agility at times. Lack of purpose.

title: ‘Challenging but worth it’
pros: Career development opportunity
cons: To balance work & life

title: ‘Fast career progression and interesting projects’
pros: Great people make it a fun place to work
cons: Low salary /bonuses compared to industry. Sometimes unsociable hours and travel

title: ‘Nice people - average salary - pleasant surroundings - completely ruled by National office’
pros: Office staff all try their best for clients & worked together really well.
cons: Being a small cog in a very large wheel - even the local office partners have their hands tied as far as National office is concerned.

title: ‘Make u face challenges’
pros: Good training opportunities
cons: Management can be hart to negotiate

title: ‘Difficult years’
pros: None at all . A terrible experience which i regret my joining in the first place
cons: No diversity and inclusion respected

title: ‘Get me out of here!’
pros:
Reputation of Big 4. Easy to jump ship if need be. 
Mix of age groups. 
Friday afternoon beers. 
There really isn't that many positives.
cons:
Job creation and dealing with risk clearance. 
Lots of bureaucracy. 
Everyone has ulterior motives to self progress and not really help you for just helping. 
Poor recognition of efforts from staff. 
Poor retention of quality staff.

title: ‘Great challenging environment to implement technology changes’
pros:
Leading edge technology being implemented
great work-life balance
great management team
cons: Being first to implement new technologies

title: ‘Long Hours, but some amazing people to work with’
pros: Depth of the team and people to work with, great contacts with many clients. Global reach back on insights.
cons:
Long long hours, difficult to balance client work with internal KPMG work.
Partnership model can be a challenge (multiple Partners)

title: ‘Hell will never work there’
pros: No good thing at all
cons: Only bosses making life  a hell

title: ‘Good to have them on my resume, never felt that it was a team environment.’
pros: Looks good on your resume.
cons: Work verses payback

title: ‘Excellent place to kick off one's career’
pros: Exposure to multiple industries; Clear support structure in terms of learning & development
cons: Poor work life balance as an M&A consultant (which comes with the territory)

title: ‘Great place to start one's career!’
pros:
Travel
Diverse range of clients
Mentally stimulating work
cons:
Low pay, long hours
Challenging to standout as performance is graded on national scale

title: ‘Never feel like not going to \"work\"’
pros: The colleagues and support from mentors
cons: Office location. At times limited guidance from top levels

title: ‘Lots of opportunity for training and development .’
pros: Further education and development, very keen on supporting further education.
cons: Struggled with the time management , particularly when trying to build customer relationships.

title: ‘Fast paced intellectually powered environment at the top end of town’
pros: Working on really interesting projects at the top end of town. A very smart work environment that challenges all deliver their best.
cons: Working for multiple Chiefs a challenge within the partnership model

title: ‘Gain knowledge and learnt to find something better quickly’
pros:
Good opportunities for career growth 
Good opportunities to learn
cons:
Poor management of staff work life balance. 
Poor management skills of Senior Managers

title: ‘Incredible experience.’
pros: Company culture, young, modern and motivating. Possibilities for secondments.
cons: Work-life balance.

title: ‘I found KPMG full of promise, but very competitive internally. It is a sink or swim environment.’
pros: Promise of opportunities, not having to find your own engagements.
cons: Strictly hierarchical model with business areas not able to work well across disciplines well. Each area has it's own view of the world.

title: ‘Great learning curve with fast professional development.’
pros:
- Work environment
- Career development
- Great people with a real drive to succeed
- Safe to fail environment
cons:
- Work/life
- Demands at times

title: ‘Great experiences, doesn't pay enough.’
pros: The ability to work on a variety of engagements was great as I got to learn a lot about how different clients and industries operate. KPMG partners can be hit and miss, some are supportive of career development whilst others only focus on chargeable work.
cons: Progression is very hard even if you hit your KPIs. Promises mean nothing and performance review periods are a lottery.

title: ‘Look for opportunities but if not option, move on’
pros: The office decor, location and overall respect from peers but only if you can build the respect
cons: Management and the revenue stream. Some staffing issues. There is no loyalty

title: ‘Exhausting, higher workload for less pay’
pros: Great social club
cons: Huge workload, and high expectations that you will put work ahead of life

title: ‘It's a really good experience. KPMG provides ample opportunities to learn and develop your skills.’
pros: Really good working experience and opportunities for development
cons: The salary range isn't quite what's expected and there is little work life balance

title: ‘You get all the glory that comes with the brand, however, you're expected to deliver with very high expectations and if you don't, you are living a recurring nightmare that you wished you hadn't chosen.’
pros: The reputation of the brand and benefits are pretty good.
cons: Long hours, very high expectations, networking, low pay.

title: ‘Fantastic company to kick-start your career’
pros: Has one of the newest and best office environments in Sydney, smart people who you can learn from, friendly culture
cons: Long working hours , tight project deadlines

title: ‘Great’
pros: Well recognized brand name
cons: Late sittings and work pressure.

title: ‘High expectations, highly competitive’
pros: Really smart colleagues
cons: Competitive environment results in questionable behaviours, particularly at higher levels. I felt like I couldn't trust many colleagues at my level.

title: ‘Great learning experience but difficult to sustain work/life stressand hours with very laborious and complex process in place for career development.’
pros: Business exposure, networking
cons: Work/life balance, expectation to do late hours as standard

title: ‘A good stepping stone’
pros: Reputation
cons: Work/life balance

title: ‘Great learning experience.’
pros: Great knowledge base.
cons: Management politics.

title: ‘Love the culture and everything about it’
pros: The culture and working conditions
cons: Hard to say because I was there for a month. Nothing to comment

title: ‘KPMG great to work for’
pros:
Easy and caring people and nothing was ever an issue for them when I asked questions

Would love to work with them again
cons:
Ipad sometimes just did not want to work.
audit letter could have been easier to manage

title: ‘Good place to start and develop your career. ’
pros: Great people to work with and interesting clients. Good opportunities to build professional relationships.
cons: Long work hours, unappreciative managers, difficult clients and onerous training programs during peak work periods.

title: ‘Burn and churn.’
pros: Good networks created with peers. Below partner level senior staff were generally great to work with.
cons: Incompetent leadership

title: ‘Would not recommend ’
pros: Not much to rate, it is a big brand
cons: No work/life balance and toxic workplace

title: ‘KPMG don't value their people.’
pros: Getting made redundant.
cons: Toxic culture from terrible leaders.

title: ‘Terrible ’
pros:
It’s a global company with global opportunity
Many intelligent people
cons:
The company’s ways of working are archaic and inefficient 
No tech or digital strategy and they lag far behind competitively
Highly reactive
Work environment can get toxic often

title: ‘Great place to start a career’
pros:
- work life balance
- professional development opportunities
- supportive environment
cons:
- the inevitable workplace politics, mainly between service lines but can happen between team members as well
- rewards and salary is market average

title: ‘Worst culture experienced ever, management untrustworthy.’
pros: There were no positive aspects to my experience with KMPG other than some colleagues being good to work with.
cons: Hostile environment  underhanded and full of partner politics

title: ‘The office environment is perfect. But the team environment, and management is not that good.  Good place to boost your career, but not for long-term stay’
pros: Good benefits includes discount gift cards,  modern office, hot desking, daily fruit etc....
cons: Hard to get promoted for those doers. More architects than specialists.  Extremely difficult to get a salary increase in switching roles.

title: ‘It was big mistake joining this organisation. They claim to be focussed on people. They are just like the other big four, just more stealthy. At least with the others the reputation is known and they don't try to claim otherwise.’
pros: Great office and there are are handful people that are talented.
cons: Management! Pre-madonnas that feel they are entitled to move up the ladder and step on those with experience and qualifications on their way up.

title: ‘The worst place to work and the worst people I have ever met.’
pros: None, the worst place I have ever worked.
cons: Working on new clients with no support from management or team.

title: ‘Tiring as hell, but the people were awesome.’
pros: The people you work alongside
cons: There is no such thing as work/life balance, despite whatever the recruiters say / company promo.

title: ‘Never again ’
pros: None, terrible work culture
cons: All of it, failure in management

title: ‘Good but not for a long term role’
pros: Good people and flexible work life
cons: Lack of progression in roles and terrible pay

title: ‘Great for the CV but not worth a long-term commitment’
pros: Great benefits and company discounts, lovely team atmosphere and support
cons: Average salary compared to industry and significantly longer hours to work for this salary

title: ‘Pigeon-holed experience, not open to professional development at the graduate level. Unprofessional and unhealthy team environment. ’
pros: Various divisions, possible space to move around/gain exposure. If you have reasonable team members and managers, it would be a place that offers you more learning opportunities.
cons: Poor management of timesheet/hours allocation. Instructed to charge majority of hours to BAU, which affects your productivity rate and ability to be promoted. Dependent on certain team managers and members.

title: ‘It sucks’
pros: Good infrastructure made available to all the employees and feel good factor that employed with Big4
cons: It is like family run business with no processes in place, no work ethics, no value system.

title: ‘Social and educational ’
pros: Lots of opportunities to work with talented people
cons:
The low wages compared to the other firms in the private industry. 
Need to improve their wages for graduates and juniors by at least 10,000 if they want to keep staff.

title: ‘Working with KPMG it is worth the value you get back’
pros: There is the opportunity to grow your career. You will learn alot. It's a good place to launch your career. There are nice people that will have your back if you make the right connections.
cons: Work-life balance and salary benefits is very low.

title: ‘Not the best experience’
pros: It was an interesting experience
cons: The culture of the organisation was sub-optimal

title: ‘The best position I have ever experienced in 25 years’
pros: Great working and life balance. Management that are proactive. Constant learning opportunities. Ability to work without negative feedback and no micromanaging.
cons:
Handover from staff that has left or moved on needs attention.
More control of Engagement decisions.

title: ‘Learnt a lot but did not enjoy the experience due to poor management ’
pros: Like minded intelligent colleagues
cons: Micro management and doing lots of things that don’t add value but done for the sake of doing it.

title: ‘Poor communication and lack of support from manager. Employees are just treated as a number only.’
pros: Company benefits. A lot of discounts for buying things like jb hi fi.
cons: 1 Managers don't listen to feedback 2.not enough motivation and support from manager.

title: ‘Highly disappointing ’
pros: Fellow Colleagues are very friendly and helpful
cons: No work life balance, no opportunities, management is discouraging and negative, procedures are not user friendly, pay is below expectations

title: ‘Do your 3, get CA and go’
pros: Obviously everyone goes to the big 4 for the same reason, you will learn alot and make life long connections, it looks good on the resume.
cons:
The reward for being good at your work is more work. Congrats!

Also head office are a painful drain.

title:
‘Work load for an OA ( operations administrator) is crazy and over the top for 55k base salary.

Better off working somewhere else ’
pros: NO good things to say
cons: Don’t get a job here as it is very poor management and the work culture is horrible. As they don’t put your well-being into consideration

title: ‘Depending on your role, you either have low-average salary in a relaxed environment or average/high salary stressful environment’
pros: I can only speak for Back-end, non-client facing which has its perks. Hot desks, casual dresswear, gym/swimming pool, relaxed environment with peer learning.
cons: Career opportunity is quite below average. Big company doesn't always mean more opportunities to do secondments or placements.

title: ‘Good organisation overall, well above average as a workplace’
pros: Ability to learn new skills and work with international & national businesses within a well organised organisation
cons: Sometimes found there was a lack of transparency and straightforward feedback

title: ‘We work hard with people we genuinely care about - colleagues and clients - and we celebrate our people and our success. ’
pros: The people,  the culture, the clients and the work
cons: Like most large organisations, senior leaders can be disconnected from their people.

title: ‘My time with KPMG has been mixed with various challenges.’
pros: Communications with staff, striving to make a difference with easy solutions.  Programming reports through excel and acting on them.  Working without supervision and seeking advice if necessary.
cons: Advising Senior Staff on solutions to a problem.  Landing on deaf ears.

title: ‘Not very great.’
pros: Flexible, open space, autonomy
cons: Overloaded with work

title: ‘On boarding was terrible ’
pros: The work life flexibility option is great
cons: On boarding is terrible and the culture of the workplace is isolating

title: ‘A great stepping stone at the early stages of your career.’
pros: Career development is always very good.
cons: Work life balance is ok most of the time

title: ‘Great Employeer ’
pros: Great work home life balance
cons: A little black and white

title: ‘Pathetic!!!’
pros: No good things to talk about.
cons: High level of dirty politics. Focus is completely on sales often leading to compromise in quality of deliverables.

title: ‘Completely overrated’
pros: Strong brand image, graduates feel special.
cons: Very poor leadership

title: ‘Bad.’
pros: All.
cons: Working there.

title: ‘Disappointing.’
pros: The Location is good.
cons: Organisational structure.

title: ‘Bad’
pros: People
cons: Politics
